alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:10PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Somerset, southeastern Wicomico, Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1009 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over West Pocomoke, or over Pocomoke City, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Snow Hill around 1035 PM EDT. Newark around 1045 PM EDT. Berlin and Ocean Pines around 1100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Horntown, Hallwood, Mappsville, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Greenbackville, Kingston, Saxis, Wallops Island and Temperanceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and southeastern Virginia.
